subject: Re: [junit] JUnit and EJB! please help, a beginner
msgSnippet: ... This is definitely an interesting project. I hope that the members of this group do not give you too much of the answers up front. If you search the web,
messageBody:
>So said james_khu on 4/19/2003 --------------------
>Hi
>
>I am a graduate student at a local university. I was just given a
>research project on how to do both unit testing and load testing of
>EJB. They told me to explore the possibility of using JUnit to unit
>test EJB.

This is definitely an interesting project. I hope that the members of this group do not give you too much of the answers up front. If you search the web, you can find a great deal on the subject.

My suggestion to you is to start by defining for yourself (and for us) what the purpose of "unit tests" is. Describe the kind of tests you envision writing -- describe what you expect those unit tests to verify. Once you do this, writing the actual code is not at all difficult.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
